body_content.explanation: a piece of material, especially cloth, that hangs across a window or opening to make a room or part of a room dark or private:
examples: Heavy curtains blocked out the sunlight.
to draw (= open or close) the curtains

body_content.explanation: a thick layer of something that makes it difficult to see anything behind it:
examples: They could see nothing through the curtain of rain/smoke.

body_content.explanation: the large screen of heavy material in a theatre that separates the stage from the area where people are watching
a short or medium-length hairstyle in which hair is parted (= separated) in the middle of the head and falls on each side of the face:
examples: The eighties had mullets but in the nineties, it was all about curtains.
